description: Use of Echo Canceller and its length.
0 : Off - Echo Canceller is turned off.
1..16 : On - Echo Canceller is turned on when the echo cancellation is requested.
Echo Canceller Length is adjustable from 8 ms to 128 ms in steps of 8 ms.
on (8) Echo Canceller Length is 64 ms.

description: Indicates that PotsConfig entry is modified successfully.
If one or more items in set cmd: ModifyPotsConfigTable are not filled by customer,
in trap we should fill these items with max value(for u_long type) or -1(for long type)
From R4.7.1M shePotsConfigAlarmSeverityIndex is obsolete as a modifiable parameter and
the alarm severity profile index for a POTS port is configured via the shePhysPortTable in
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigModifiedTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPotsPortPriorityLevel i 1 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPptpProfileIndex u 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigAnalogIfProfileIndex u 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigAlarmSeverityIndex i 1 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortQuitMode i 1 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlIfIndexBitMask s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAM SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlTimeStamp t 31536000

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This parameter assigns a priority level to the port to manage the right of a port to
establish or to receive a call/session under high load conditions dependent on the number
of used or available DSP channel resources on the voice line card.
The resource usage levels relevant for each priority level is managed in the priority profile
(sheVoipCallPriorityProfileTable) assigned to the VGW (sheVoipVgwPrioProfileIndex) in the VGW
level1(1) - the highest priority level; the port can establish or receive a call, if the
resource load is below the 'Level 1' limit as defined in the associated priority
level2(2) - the port can establish or receive a call, if the resource load is below the
'Level 2' limit as defined in the associated priority profile
level3(3) - the lowest priority level (default); the port can establish or receive a call,
if the resource load is below the 'Level 3' limit as defined in the associated
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPotsPortPriorityLevel

description: Value of shePotsPptpProfileIndex of the PPTP Profile assigned to this POTS interface.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPptpProfileIndex

description: Value of sheVoipPotsAnalogIfProfileIndex of the POTS Analog Interface Profile
Modification of the assignment to a POTS Analog Interface Profile
requires a restart of the affected IU(s) in order for the parameters
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigAnalogIfProfileIndex

description: This object mirrors the value of shePhysPortAlarmSeverityIndex in the shePhysPortTable for
the given ifIndex and is a pointer to the instance of the Alarm Severity Profile that
contains the severity assignments for alarms reported by this POTS interface.
The value can only be modified via the shePhysPortTable.
Prior to R4.7.1M, Alarm Severity Profiles could be assigned to POTS ports both in the
shePhysPortTable and the shePotsConfigTable, which lead to confusion to which Alarm
Severity Profile applied to which alarms.
From R4.7.1M the assignment of an Alarm Severity Profile to POTS ports has been unified
with that of non-POTS ports and simplified, so that only a single Alarm Severity Profile
is assigned to POTS ports as for non-POTS ports via the shePhysPortTable.
For compatibiltiy purposes, shePotsConfigAlarmSeverityIndex mirrors the value of
shePhysPortTable, but cannot be modified via the shePotsConfigTable.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigAlarmSeverityIndex

description: Termination quitting mode, configured to either graceful or forced.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortQuitMode

description: A bit-mask indicating which ifIndices the control request is to apply to.
The bit-mask is in the form of an Octet String of size 256 octets (2048 bits).
Each bit represents a value of an ifIndex in the range 0..2047 beginning from
bit 0 in Octet 1 (ifIndex=0) to bit 7 in Octet 256 (ifIndex=2047).
The octet for a given ifIndex is given by use of integer division as follows:
The bit number within the octet calculated above is then given by
Valid values for ifIndex (and corresponding bits) depends on
- number of slots supported by the NE
- which slots (IU cards) are applicable to the control request
- the number of supported ports on the card.
For POTS cards with 72 ports, only the following ifIndex values would be valid:
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlIfIndexBitMask

description: Trap is sent out when line test is finished.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigTestFinishedTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortStatus i 0 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigLastTest i 0 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigILTFResult1 u 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigILTFResult2 u 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigILTFResult3 u 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlReqResult i 1 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlTimeStamp t 31536000

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: shePotsConfigPortStatus indicates the operating status of the POTS port.
The operating status of the POTS portis dependent on ifOperStatus,
ifOperStatus is the operating status of the interface, which in turn is dependent on
ifAdminStatus, the administrative state of the interface.
shePotsIltfRequestStatePortTestState is the ILTF state of this port and
shePotsIltfRequestStatePortTestModeState indicates the state of the test mode for
the port. See the shePotsIltfMib for more details.
Only the values above are possible.
If ifAdminStatus is down(2), then shePotsConfigPortStatus will go to down(0).
The testing(3) state indicates that testing is taking place on the port and
that no operational packets can currently be passed across the interface.
Tests may be started via the shePotsIltfMib in any state, but dependent on
the state may require an explicit 'forced' test start, e.g., in state busy(1).
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortStatus

description: Starting with R2.7M all linetest configurations could only be set via she-pots-linetest-mib.
Same MIB contain also all result tables.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigLastTest

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortStatusChangedTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortStatus i 0 SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlTimeStamp t 31536000

description: shePotsConfigPortStatus indicates the operating status of the POTS port.
The operating status of the POTS portis dependent on ifOperStatus,
ifOperStatus is the operating status of the interface, which in turn is dependent on
ifAdminStatus, the administrative state of the interface.
shePotsIltfRequestStatePortTestState is the ILTF state of this port and
shePotsIltfRequestStatePortTestModeState indicates the state of the test mode for
the port. See the shePotsIltfMib for more details.
Only the values above are possible.
If ifAdminStatus is down(2), then shePotsConfigPortStatus will go to down(0).
The testing(3) state indicates that testing is taking place on the port and
that no operational packets can currently be passed across the interface.
Tests may be started via the shePotsIltfMib in any state, but dependent on
the state may require an explicit 'forced' test start, e.g., in state busy(1).
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigPortStatus

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlTimeStamp

description: This trap is sent out when port status is changed by MGC sends
Error Code 430 unknown termId or 502 Not Ready. MG will disable power
feeding, reset event descriptor to empty and keep

event.Summary: Configuration fake off hook detection delay ($v2) modified

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsConfigControlTimeStamp

description: This parameter configures the Fake Off-Hook (FOH) detection
delay to be applied to a port.
Under certain circumstances, such as cabling problems, off-
hook events may be detected on the line even when the
subscriber has not gone off-hook. To detect these fake off-
hooks, the NE is able to perform further measurements on the
line following each off-hook event. This parameter configures
the delay in milliseconds from receipt of the off-hook event
until the measurements are to be performed. Configuration of
the specific measurements are made in the Voice Control
Processor (VCP) Profile assigned to the card on which the port
Use the Fake Off-Hook configuration from the VCP
Profile assigned to the card on which the port is
This value specifies a minimum delay between
receipt of an Off-Hook event and performance of

description: Type of on-hook Calling Line Identification Presentation (CLIP).
fskBellcoreMdmf(1) - FSK / Bellcore Multiple Data Message Format
fskEtsiRpasPrering(2) - FSK / ETSI Data transmission prior to ringing - Ringing Pulse Alerting Signal (RP-AS)
fskBellcoreSdmf(3) - FSK / Bellcore Single Data Message Format
fskEtsiDtasPrering(4) - FSK / ETSI Data transmission prior to ringing - Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS)
fskEtsiLrdtasPrering(5) - FSK / ETSI Data transmission prior to ringing - a line reversal followed by a DT-AS
fskEtsiDuringRing(6) - FSK / ETSI Data transmission during ringing
russianAon(8) - Russian standard Avtomaticheskoe Opredelenie Nomera (Automatic Number Identification)
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsSipUserDataConfigOnHookCLIP

description: Off-hook Calling Line Identification Presentation (CLIP) enable/disable.
This object only enables or disables off hook CLIP, but does not explicitly select the
standard as implied by the enumerated list of values available.
Regardless of the standard selected here, the actual standard used for off hook CLIP
depends on the standard configured for on hook CLIP in shePotsSipUserDataConfigOnHookCLIP
OffHookCLIP OffHookCLIP OnHookCLIP Standard OffHookCLIP Standard Used

variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsSipUserDataConfigAuthID

description: The preconfig destination of warmline automatic dialing.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsSipUserDataConfigHWLineDest

description: The main function of this feature is to postpone the sending of the SIP message BYE from
B-side MSAN to control network after detection of the hook-on event with a duration of a
call suspend timer. I.e. there is no immediate SIP signalling to control network after hook-on.
If in this time a new hook-off event at B-side is detected, then the call has to be continued.
If in this time a SIP release message BYE from A-side/network is received in MSAN, then the
If in this time no hook-off event at B-side or no release by A-side/network received
then the B-MSAN has to release the call with destroying of the RTP channel resources and
sending of the SIP message BYE.
0 - disable the feature and there is an immediate SIP signalling BYE to control network after hook-on at B-side.
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsSipUserDataConfigCallSuspendTimer

description: This notification indicates that the object shePotsSipUserDataConfigPPreferredIDValue
of a POTS SIP user has changed.
This trap can be sent as a collected trap, which means that this notification
may contain more than one shePotsSipUserDataConfigPPreferredIDValue object.
In certain circumstances, it is possible that more than a single POTS SIP user
may be impacted at any one time and to potentially avoid sending a flood of
individual traps for each user, the columnar objects of each affected POTS SIP
user will collected in this single trap on a per card basis.
Therefore, it is possible that only one notification per card is sent
containing the shePotsSipUserDataConfigPPreferredIDValue of all affected

description: This configuration determines how shePotsSipUserDataConfigUserName is
hwId(0) - The HW-ID is used to automatically generate
emptyString(1) - shePotsSipUserDataConfigUserName must be supplied by
To modify the SIP User Name Initialization Mode it is necessary to
lock all VGWs! Note that as a consequencethe ports are momentarily
The commissioning status of voice user ports is determined via the
availability of a valid (unique) SIP User Name assigned to the SIP
User Agent of the voice port with the following consequencies:
- SIP User Data configurations without SIP User Name
(EMPTY value, length zero) are handled as decommissioned voice
- SIP User Data configurations with SIP User Name (default = HW-ID
or customized) are handled as commissioned voice ports.
When hwId(0) is configured (default) there will be no empty
that shePotsSipUserDataConfigPortStatus will never enter the
p0NotCreated(0) state and that the counter sheVoipPmMSANBasedPortNotCreatedNum
When emptyString(1) is configured, the value of shePotsSipUserDataConfigUserName
for newly created ports will be an empty string. This means that the port will
be in the p0NotCreated(0) state and will not be registered. The counter
sheVoipPmMSANBasedPortNotCreatedNum will report the number of such ports currently
On changing the mode, only default values will be modified and any previously
provisioned values will not be affected.

description: A bit-mask indicating which ifIndices the control request is to apply to.
The bit-mask is in the form of an Octet String of size 256 octets (2048 bits).
Each bit represents a value of an ifIndex in the range 0..2047 beginning from
bit 0 in Octet 1 (ifIndex=0) to bit 7 in Octet 256 (ifIndex=2047).
The octet for a given ifIndex is given by use of integer division as follows:
The bit number within the octet calculated above is then given by
Valid values for ifIndex (and corresponding bits) depends on
- number of slots supported by the NE
- which slots (IU cards) are applicable to the control request
- the number of supported ports on the card.
For POTS cards with 72 ports, only the following ifIndex values would be valid:
variables.name: SHE-POTS-MIB::shePotsSipUserDataConfigControlIfIndexBitMask
